intro: Ruilopezia cuatrecasasii, commonly known as the Cuatrecasas' ruilopezia, is a rare and unique plant belonging to the Poaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, greenish flowers. It is native to specific regions in Mexico, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
